text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

Growing up in Tokyo
to a Japanese mother

and an American father, aviation
played a big role in my life

by allowing me to connect with
my grandparents and relatives
who lived in the US.

Ever since, I've been
inspired by aviation's ability

to connect people and
facilitate the exchange of ideas

and cultures, and truly make
the world a smaller place.

During the COVID pandemic,
travel became much more

difficult for all
of us, and I truly

realized that we can't take
air travel for granted.

Now, aviation and the
world faces the challenge

of climate change, and
aviation is one of the hardest
industries to decarbonize.

So my life's mission
and purpose is

to help accelerate
the path of aviation

towards decarbonization
so that aviation becomes

a solution for a more
sustainable future

and so that people
all over the world

can experience the beauty of air
travel for generations to come.
